head.supplied: 29/1/93. ¶ ¶ This day, in the quietness of the Sunday, dear Mr Holtze, I elaborated carefully your N. 1340, namely Aristolochia Holtzei. ¶ ¶ It is different from all the Indian species, and nearest ...

div.p: GRG 19/391, State Records of South Australia, Adelaide.
This day, in the quietness of the Sunday, dear Mr Holtze, I elaborated carefully your N. 1340, namely Aristolochia Holtzei.

It is different from all the Indian species, and nearest to A. Thozetii. If the plant is within your reach, I would ask for some more specimens in flower and fruit, so that we might see, whether it varies in form of leaves and in other organs. The description will appear in the next number of the Vict. Naturalist
B93.02.02, p. 160.
I have done something to the remaining Utricularias &c.; but in this year of anxieties I had keenly to watch the rural and other practical aspects of the Department.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: Should at any time you notice any fungs there, even minute ones on leaves, will you kindly send them. There must be some.
